This file contains integration tests for the Datadog GraphQL plugin, verifying its instrumentation and span generation across different GraphQL library versions and configurations.

This file contains integration tests for the Datadog GraphQL plugin, specifically verifying its instrumentation capabilities in an ECMAScript Modules (ESM) environment for both standard GraphQL and GraphQL Yoga servers across different GraphQL versions.
This file instruments Azure Functions to enable distributed tracing with Datadog. It patches various trigger handlers (e.g., HTTP, Service Bus, Event Hub) to wrap them with tracing logic.
Initializes and registers the Datadog tracing instrumentation for AWS Lambda functions, unless explicitly disabled via environment variables.

This file patches AWS Lambda function handlers at runtime to inject Datadog tracing and instrumentation. It supports patching both the Datadog Lambda wrapper and user-defined handlers specified via environment variables.

This file registers a hook to dynamically patch the AWS Lambda handler module at runtime, applying Datadog-specific instrumentations when the handler is required. It extracts module information from environment variables like `DD_LAMBDA_HANDLER`.
This file contains unit tests for utility functions that extract module root, module name, and handler path from AWS Lambda handler strings.
This file defines a Datadog tracing plugin for AWS Lambda, injecting trace context into synchronous Lambda invocations and generating relevant tags for spans.

This file implements a tracing plugin for Datadog APM to instrument Azure Functions. It automatically creates, configures, and manages spans for various Azure Function triggers like HTTP, Service Bus, and Event Hubs, extracting and propagating trace context.

This file contains integration tests for the Datadog Azure Functions plugin, specifically verifying tracing and span propagation for messages processed via Azure Service Bus queues with different message types and cardinalities.

This file contains integration tests for the Datadog Azure Functions plugin, verifying its ability to instrument HTTP-triggered functions and propagate tracing context. It starts an Azure Function app, makes HTTP requests, and asserts that the expected traces are generated by the Datadog agent.

Continuous Profiler.description: An always-on, low-overhead code profiler that continuously analyzes CPU and memory usage in production environments. It helps identify performance bottlenecks and inefficient code without impacting application performance.

files.description: This file configures and starts a profiling session for benchmarking purposes. It dynamically selects between wall-clock and space profiling based on an environment variable.
This file is an integration test for the Datadog profiler, designed to simulate a CPU-intensive workload for a configurable duration to test profiling capabilities.
This file is an integration test helper for the Datadog profiler, designed to test profiler activation heuristics by optionally creating a span or simulating a long-lived process.

This file contains integration tests for the Datadog Node.js profiler. It sets up child processes to run profiled code, captures the generated profiling data, and asserts that the data is correctly formatted and sent to a fake agent for various profile types (e.g., wall, space, events, network, filesystem).

This file provides an interface to start and stop the profiler functionality within the `dd-trace-js` package. It manages the lifecycle of the profiler, including stopping it gracefully on application exit.

This file initializes and exports the core profiling components for the 'dd-trace-js' package, including the main profiler instance (which adapts for serverless environments) and various associated profilers, exporters, and loggers.
This file defines the heuristics used under Server-Side Instrumentation (SSI) to determine when to trigger the profiler, based on conditions like process longevity and span creation.
This file provides utility functions for identifying web server spans, deriving endpoint names from span tags, and retrieving active spans from a trace context within the tracing library.

This file is a command-line interface (CLI) tool for exporting pprof profiles. It reads a profile from a specified JSON file, along with URLs, tags, and profile type from command-line arguments, then encodes and sends the profile to various destinations like the Datadog Agent or local files.

This file defines the Profiler class, which is responsible for coordinating, collecting, encoding, and submitting various types of performance profiles (e.g., CPU, heap) for a Node.js application to Datadog. It manages the lifecycle of profiling, including starting/stopping, interval-based collection, source map integration, and compression of profile data.

This file defines the configuration class for the profiling subsystem, responsible for loading and managing various profiling settings, including enabling/disabling profilers, configuring exporters, and setting operational parameters based on environment variables and options.
This file defines a `ConsoleLogger` class that provides a simple console-based logger with severity level filtering for debugging and profiling purposes.
This file defines a `FileExporter` class responsible for writing profiling data (e.g., .pprof files) and associated event data (.json files) to the local filesystem for storage and analysis.

This file contains tests for the profiling configuration logic, ensuring it correctly handles default values, various options, and environment variables for profiling settings like profilers, exporters, and specific profiling features.
Tests the functionality for determining and calculating the effective size of the libuv thread pool, including parsing environment variables and handling various edge cases and default values.

This file contains unit tests for the profiler component, verifying its functionality related to starting, stopping, collecting, encoding, and exporting profiles under various conditions, including error handling and compression types.
This file contains unit tests for the profiling file exporter, ensuring it correctly writes profiling data to files with appropriate naming conventions and optional prefixes.

This file contains unit tests for the `ConsoleLogger` class, verifying its logging behavior across different log levels (error, warn, info, debug). It ensures that the logger correctly delegates messages to the underlying `console` methods based on the configured level.

This file is an integration test for network connections, establishing two sequential connections to local ports and validating a received message, likely to test or profile `dd-trace`'s network monitoring capabilities.
This integration test verifies Datadog profiler's tracing of file system operations by writing, reading, and deleting a temporary file with random data.
This file is an integration test for the Datadog Node.js tracer's profiler, specifically designed to test its interaction with and tracing of various DNS lookup and resolution operations.
Defines a profiling event plugin specifically for DNS (Domain Name System) events. It registers itself with the ID 'dns' and specifies 'dns' as its entry type for profiling.
This file implements an event plugin for profiling Node.js filesystem operations, filtering out synchronous events and sanitizing event details by only including allowed string or number parameters.

This file implements a profiling plugin specifically for capturing details of DNS lookup operations. It extends a base DNS plugin to record events related to DNS lookups, including the hostname being resolved.

Provides a base class for profiling event plugins, measuring the duration of operations and associating them with tracing spans before being processed by a handler. It leverages tracing plugin functionality to bind to diagnostic channels and collect performance metrics for profiling.

This file defines a plugin for the Datadog tracer that profiles and enriches DNS resolution events. It categorizes DNS queries by their record type (e.g., A, AAAA) and records the host being resolved.
This file defines the `NetPlugin`, an event plugin responsible for capturing and extending network-related events, specifically TCP connections, for profiling within the Datadog tracing library.

This file defines a plugin for tracing or profiling reverse DNS lookups (e.g., `getHostByAddr`). It extends a base DNS plugin to capture details specific to reverse operations, such as the IP address being resolved.

This file defines a `DNSLookupServicePlugin` responsible for tracing and profiling `lookupService` DNS operations. It extends a base DNS plugin to capture specific host and port details for profiling events.

This file is an integration test for the Datadog profiler, designed to generate CPU-intensive workloads within traced spans to test code hotspot identification and context propagation across asynchronous operations.
An integration test designed to intentionally leak memory, potentially across multiple worker threads, to observe and test out-of-memory (OOM) conditions in conjunction with a profiler.

This file is responsible for scheduling and writing V8 heap snapshots to a specified directory, optionally performing garbage collection before each snapshot. It helps in monitoring memory usage over time.
This file defines and exports constants related to profiling, specifically different kinds of snapshots and strategies for exporting data during out-of-memory events.

This file determines the effective Libuv thread pool size and available parallelism for Node.js applications, accounting for environment variables and Node.js-specific interpretations of thread pool settings.
This file provides a utility object `tagger` with a `parse` method. Its purpose is to normalize various input tag formats (string, array of strings, or object) into a standardized key-value object.
This file provides utility functions and constants for profiling, primarily focused on identifying and labeling threads (main, worker, non-JS) and encoding profiles using `@datadog/pprof`.
This file defines a native space profiler responsible for monitoring heap usage, detecting potential out-of-memory (OOM) conditions, and generating heap profiles using the @datadog/pprof library.

This file captures Node.js `perf_hooks` events (e.g., GC, DNS, network, filesystem) and serializes them into a pprof-compatible 'timeline' profile format. It includes decorators to add detailed labels to these events.

Implements a Poisson process-based sampling filter that decides whether to sample an event based on its timing relative to probabilistically determined sampling instants. It's used for profiling to select events for further analysis.

This file implements the `NativeWallProfiler` which uses `@datadog/pprof` to perform wall-time profiling, capturing call stacks and associating them with tracing spans, code hotspots, and endpoint information. It integrates with async context management to track the active span for profiling contexts.

This file defines the `EventSerializer` class, which is responsible for serializing profiling event data into a standardized JSON format for export or reporting. It constructs a detailed JSON object containing profile attachments, timing information, application, platform, profiler, and runtime metadata.

This test file verifies the functionality of taking heap snapshots over time, ensuring that the specified number of snapshots are created and saved to the correct destination with the expected naming pattern.

This file defines custom Chai assertion properties used for validating the structure and types of profiling data objects, such as those conforming to the pprof format. It ensures that profile components like value types, samples, locations, and functions adhere to expected schemas.
This file contains unit tests for the `tagger` module's `parse` method, verifying its ability to correctly parse and format different input types into a standardized tag object for profiling data.

This file contains unit tests for the `EventsProfiler`, which is responsible for collecting and managing event data for profiling purposes. It verifies the profiler's information retrieval and its ability to limit the number of collected events.
This file contains unit tests for the PoissonProcessSamplingFilter class, verifying its initialization, error handling, and event sampling logic within the profiling component.
This file contains unit tests for the `NativeSpaceProfiler`, verifying its functionality for starting, stopping, collecting, and encoding heap profiles using a mocked `@datadog/pprof` module.

This file contains unit tests for the native wall profiler (`NativeWallProfiler`), ensuring it correctly starts, stops, collects, and encodes profiles using the `@datadog/pprof` library. It also verifies the profiler's configuration options and its ability to generate appropriate sample labels from various context inputs.

Open Standards Integration.description: Ensures interoperability with cloud-native observability standards. This module provides native support for OpenTelemetry for trace and metric collection and OpenFeature for standardized feature flag evaluation.

files.description: This file contains benchmarks for the `ExposuresWriter` component, evaluating the performance of its `append` and `makePayload` methods when processing OpenFeature exposure events under various conditions (e.g., enabled/disabled, single event vs. array of events).

This file contains integration tests for Datadog's OpenFeature flagging provider, focusing on how it generates and sends exposure events and handles remote configuration acknowledgments, with scenarios for both manual and automatic event flushing.

This file is an integration test application that uses Datadog's OpenFeature integration to evaluate feature flags under various contexts. It includes endpoints to test single and multiple flag evaluations, and also tests manual trace flushing capabilities.

This file provides predefined Universal Flag Configuration (UFC) payloads. These payloads serve as fixtures for OpenFeature integration tests, defining various boolean and string feature flags with their respective variations and allocation rules.

This file provides a no-operation (noop) implementation of an OpenFeature flagging provider. It is used when the OpenFeature provider is not initialized or disabled, always returning default values for flag evaluations.

This file defines an OpenFeature provider, `FlaggingProvider`, which integrates with Datadog's feature flagging system. It extends the `DatadogNodeServerProvider` to manage flag configurations, incorporating tracer integration and handling updates from Remote Config.

This file manages the lifecycle of the OpenFeature module, enabling and disabling the collection and writing of exposure events using an `ExposuresWriter` and integrating with a channel-based event system.

This file integrates Datadog's remote configuration with OpenFeature for managing feature flags. It enables remote configuration capabilities and registers a handler to apply feature flag configurations received from Datadog's remote config service to the OpenFeature provider.
This utility file determines whether a feature flag evaluation (FFE) writer should be enabled based on the detected capabilities of the Datadog Agent, specifically checking for EVP proxy support.
This file defines the `ExposuresWriter` class, which is responsible for collecting, formatting, and sending OpenFeature exposure events to the Datadog Agent.

This file defines the `BaseFFEWriter` class, a base class for buffering, serializing, and periodically sending Feature Flagging & Exposure Events (FFE) payloads to the Datadog Agent. It manages event buffering, size limits, and HTTP requests to the agent.
This file defines constants for Datadog's Event Platform (EVP) integration, exposure event handling, and OpenFeature feature flag evaluation within the `dd-trace` library.
This file contains unit tests for the OpenFeature integration module, verifying its enable/disable functionality and proper handling of exposure events through an exposures writer.

This file contains unit tests for the `NoopFlaggingProvider` class, ensuring its OpenFeature interface methods, configuration handling, and promise-based evaluations function as expected for a no-operation feature flag provider.

This file contains unit tests for the OpenFeature remote configuration module, specifically verifying the `enable` function's behavior regarding remote config capabilities, product handler registration, and how it processes configuration updates.
This file contains unit tests for the `FlaggingProvider` module, verifying its constructor, configuration handling, logging, and inheritance from `DatadogNodeServerProvider`.
This file contains unit tests for the OpenFeature Exposures Writer, which is responsible for collecting, formatting, and sending OpenFeature exposure events to the Datadog agent.

This file contains integration tests for the Datadog Node.js tracer's OpenTelemetry compatibility. It verifies how the tracer handles various OpenTelemetry environment variables, including conflicts and invalid configurations, and ensures that telemetry and tracing data are captured correctly.
This file is an OpenTelemetry integration test that initializes `dd-trace` as an OpenTelemetry provider and creates a basic active span to verify tracing functionality.

This file implements an integration test server that uses both Datadog tracing and OpenTelemetry tracing. It sets up an HTTP server to demonstrate the interaction between spans created by both tracing libraries.
This file conditionally instruments the OpenTelemetry NodeTracerProvider to route OpenTelemetry traces through Datadog's tracing system, enabling integration between the two.
This file implements the OpenTelemetry Baggage API, providing functions to manage key-value pairs (baggage items) that are propagated across asynchronous operations using async local storage.

This file defines the `HttpPropagator` class, which extends `TextMapPropagator` to handle OpenTracing context propagation specifically over HTTP headers. It facilitates injecting and extracting trace context from HTTP requests and responses.
This file defines OpenTelemetry span processors, including a no-operation (noop) processor and a multi-processor that delegates calls to an array of other span processors.
This file defines a placeholder `Sampler` class for OpenTelemetry within the Datadog tracing library, intended for future use in making sampling decisions.

This file implements an OpenTelemetry-compatible SpanContext, acting as an adapter for Datadog's internal SpanContext to expose trace and span identifiers, trace flags, and trace state according to OpenTelemetry specifications.

This file implements the OpenTelemetry TracerProvider, responsible for creating and managing tracers, configuring span processors, and setting up global OpenTelemetry context and propagation within the application.

This file defines a custom OpenTelemetry `Tracer` implementation that bridges OpenTelemetry concepts with Datadog's internal tracing system. It handles span creation, context propagation, and conversion between OpenTelemetry and Datadog span contexts.
Manages and translates trace contexts, including baggage, between Datadog's internal tracing system and the OpenTelemetry API to ensure interoperability.

This file defines the OpenTelemetry Span class for Datadog's tracer, acting as an adapter that translates OpenTelemetry API calls and span concepts into Datadog's internal span representation. It handles attribute mapping, span naming conventions, and lifecycle management for OpenTelemetry-compatible spans.
Tests the OpenTelemetry `MultiSpanProcessor` class to ensure it correctly delegates `onStart`, `onEnd`, `forceFlush`, and `shutdown` calls to its registered span processors.
This file contains tests for the OpenTelemetry sampler implementation within the Datadog tracing library, verifying its sampling behavior and string representation.
This file contains unit tests for the OpenTelemetry span implementation within the Datadog tracing library, verifying its behavior for span creation, naming, attributes, context, and links.

This file contains unit tests for the `SpanContext` class in the `dd-trace-js` OpenTelemetry integration. It verifies the proper creation, handling of trace and span IDs, sampling priority mapping, and trace state serialization within the OpenTelemetry SpanContext.

This file contains unit tests for the OpenTelemetry TracerProvider implementation in the dd-trace-js library, verifying its registration with the OTel API, tracer creation, and span processor management.

This file contains unit tests for the OpenTelemetry Context Manager, verifying its functionality for context creation, propagation, and interaction with Datadog spans and baggage within the tracing library.

This file contains unit tests for the OpenTelemetry Tracer implementation in dd-trace-js, verifying its functionality for creating and managing spans. It specifically tests span creation, attribute handling, kind and start time settings, and ensures correct parenting and nesting behavior between OpenTelemetry and native Datadog spans.

This file contains compatibility tests for the `dd-trace-js` library against the OpenTracing API specification. It includes a shim for `chai` to facilitate running the upstream OpenTracing compatibility checks.

This file contains unit tests for the `SpanContext` class, verifying its instantiation with various properties, default values, and methods for converting trace and span IDs to different formats like `toTraceId()`, `toSpanId()`, and `toTraceparent()`.

This file contains unit tests for the TextMapPropagator, verifying its ability to inject OpenTracing span contexts, including trace IDs, span IDs, sampling priority, origin, trace tags, and baggage items, into various carrier formats like Datadog, B3, and W3C Baggage headers.

This file contains unit tests for the `TraceState` class, verifying its ability to parse, serialize, and manipulate W3C TraceState headers, including vendor-specific data for Datadog. It ensures correct conversion between string and object representations and proper modification of state.

This file defines the `MeterProvider` class, which serves as the entry point for creating and managing OpenTelemetry-compatible `Meter` instances for metric collection, specifically configured for exporting to the Datadog Agent.
This file implements an OpenTelemetry Protocol (OTLP) HTTP metric exporter, responsible for transforming and sending collected metrics to a configured OTLP endpoint over HTTP.
This file defines and exports constants related to OpenTelemetry metrics, including metric types, temporality settings, default histogram bucket boundaries, and measurement queue size.
Provides a custom OpenTelemetry Metrics implementation for the Datadog tracing library, including components for creating instruments, recording measurements, and exporting metrics via OTLP.

This file defines the `Meter` class, which implements the OpenTelemetry Meter API. It provides methods to create and manage various OpenTelemetry-compatible metric instruments like counters, histograms, and gauges.

This file implements a `PeriodicMetricReader` for OpenTelemetry metrics, which periodically collects, aggregates, and exports metric measurements to a configured exporter. It includes a `MetricAggregator` to process raw measurements into different metric types and temporality preferences.

This file implements various OpenTelemetry metric instrument types, including synchronous (Counter, Histogram, Gauge) and asynchronous (ObservableGauge, ObservableCounter) instruments, for recording and managing metric measurements.

This file defines the `OtlpTransformer` class, which is responsible for converting aggregated OpenTelemetry metrics into the OTLP (OpenTelemetry Protocol) format, supporting both protobuf and JSON serialization. It processes various metric types and their data points, preparing them for transmission.
This file defines a base class for OpenTelemetry Protocol (OTLP) HTTP exporters, providing common functionality for configuring and sending data over HTTP, as well as recording telemetry metrics.

This file defines a base class for transforming data into OpenTelemetry Protocol (OTLP) format, providing common utilities for attribute conversion, resource handling, and serialization to either Protobuf or JSON.
This module loads OpenTelemetry Protocol (OTLP) protobuf definitions for logs and metrics, providing access to the parsed protobuf types for OTLP services and enums.

This file contains unit tests for the OpenTelemetry metrics implementation within the dd-trace-js library. It verifies the correct creation, recording, and OTLP export of various OpenTelemetry metric types like counters, histograms, and gauges.
This file provides a utility function `executeRequest` for making HTTP requests. It is likely used within integration tests to interact with services and assert responses.

This file provides utility functions for synchronously executing shell commands, with capabilities to display the executed command and capture its output. It wraps `child_process.execSync` for easier use in scripts.
Provides a helper function to print formatted, colored titles with decorative lines to the console. It's likely used in scripts for better output readability.
This file exports ANSI escape codes as constants to apply colors to terminal output. It provides common color codes like gray, cyan, and a reset code for styling console messages.
This file contains unit tests for the `set` utility function, which is responsible for setting values at specified paths within an object.
This file contains unit tests for the `parseTags` utility function, verifying its ability to transform flat, dot-separated tag strings into structured JavaScript objects, including array-like keys.
This file exports a utility function named `uniq` that removes duplicate values from an array, returning a new array containing only the unique elements.
Utility function that creates a new object composed of the picked object properties.

This file exports a utility function that converts a given string into kebab-case format. It handles camelCase, spaces, and underscores, ensuring the output is consistently lowercased and hyphen-separated.

This file provides a utility function to convert a flat object of dot-separated tags into a deeply nested object structure. It intelligently handles array-like keys to create arrays within the nested object.
This file exports a utility function that assigns a value to a deeply nested property within an object, creating intermediate objects along the path if they don't already exist.
This file serves as the main entry point for the datadog-shimmer package, re-exporting the core shimmering functionality from './src/shimmer.js'.

This file provides a utility function to programmatically locate and parse the `package.json` file for a given module, mimicking the behavior of `require(`${name}/package.json`)` from older Node.js versions.
This file provides a utility function for adding key-value pairs (tags) to an object, supporting different input formats such as strings, arrays, or objects.

This file provides a collection of general utility functions, including type checks, string manipulations, glob pattern matching, and environment-specific path and configuration normalizations, for use across the `dd-trace-js` package.
This utility file provides a function `isTrue` to check if a given string represents a true boolean value (i.e., 'true' or '1').
This file implements a basic logging utility for the `dd-trace` package, enabling conditional console output based on `DD_TRACE_DEBUG` and `DD_TRACE_LOG_LEVEL` environment variables.
This file serves as the main entry point for the MessagePack (msgpack) module, exporting the MsgpackChunk and MsgpackEncoder classes for use within the application.

This file defines a MsgpackEncoder class responsible for serializing JavaScript values into the MessagePack binary format. It includes methods for encoding various data types such as numbers, strings, booleans, arrays, objects, and binary data.

This file provides a utility function, `memoize`, which caches the results of a function based on its first argument to improve performance. It helps avoid redundant computations by returning previously computed values.

This file implements a logging utility for the application, providing various log levels (trace, debug, info, warn, error), configuration management, and integration with an internal log writer and channels.

This file implements a flexible logging utility that allows for custom logger integration, control over logging levels and subscriptions, and context-aware logging to prevent interference with other operations.

This file provides utility functions for filtering URLs based on allowlists and blocklists, supporting various filter types like functions, regular expressions, and arrays. It exports a `urlFilter` object that can generate a URL filtering function based on a given configuration.

This file provides a utility function `tagsFromObject` that converts an arbitrary JavaScript object into a flattened map of normalized tags. It applies rules for truncating values, redacting sensitive keys, escaping special characters, and limiting the total number of generated tags.

This file implements a custom `FormData` class that extends Node.js `Readable` stream, designed to construct `multipart/form-data` payloads for HTTP requests, supporting both key-value pairs and file uploads.

This file provides a polyfill for Node.js's `urlToHttpOptions` function, ensuring compatibility with older Node.js versions, particularly for environments like Cypress that may use an outdated built-in Node.js runtime. It exports the native function if available, otherwise it provides a custom implementation.

This file provides a utility for making HTTP/HTTPS requests, including handling different protocols (e.g., Unix sockets), managing concurrent requests, decompressing gzipped responses, and implementing retry logic for robust communication with external services.
This file contains unit tests for the `requirePackageJson` utility function, ensuring it can correctly read and parse `package.json` files from various paths.

This file contains unit tests for the logging utility module, `src/log.js`. It verifies the module's configuration, environment variable parsing, and the behavior of its logging methods (e.g., debug, trace, error) under various conditions.
This file contains unit tests for the utility functions `isTrue`, `isFalse`, and `globMatch` found in the `../src/util` module. It defines various test cases to verify their correct behavior.

This file contains unit tests for the `ip_extractor` utility. It verifies that the utility correctly extracts IP addresses from various HTTP headers, including standard and custom headers, and handles different IPv4 and IPv6 formats, as well as multiple IP entries.

This directory is intended to house test fixtures, mock data, or static files used specifically for testing utility functions within the `dd-trace` plugins. Although currently empty, its purpose is to provide consistent test environments for plugin-related utilities.

This file provides a utility function `waitForLimitd` that attempts to connect to a local limitd service on port 9231 until it is responsive. It is likely used in a test setup to ensure the limitd service is available before running tests.

This file defines a utility function `waitForMysql` that attempts to connect to a MySQL database with retries. It is likely used in test setups to ensure the MySQL service is available before tests are executed.
This file implements a simple HTTP/HTTPS proxy server. It forwards standard HTTP requests and handles HTTP CONNECT tunneling for encrypted (HTTPS) connections.

LLM Observability.description: Delivers monitoring for applications using Large Language Models (LLMs). It traces LLM prompts and responses, tracks token usage, and measures performance to provide insights into the cost, quality, and latency of AI-powered features.

files.description: This file instruments the '@langchain/core' library for Datadog tracing by applying registered hooks.

This file instruments the Vercel AI SDK to add Datadog tracing for AI operations, such as text and object generation, embeddings, and tool usage, by wrapping key functions and managing span lifecycle events.

This file defines a list of functions and methods within the `@langchain/core` library that should be instrumented for tracing by Datadog. It specifies the module, file path, method name, and class for each function to be traced.

This file implements a Datadog LLM Observability plugin for the Vercel AI SDK, handling the extraction and tagging of AI operations such as embeddings, text/object generation, and tool calls for tracing purposes.

This file defines a collection of plugins for integrating various LangChain operations with Datadog's LLM Observability (LLMObs). It provides handlers and logic to extract metadata, set tags, and determine the type and kind of LLM interactions within LangChain applications.

This file defines a handler for LangChain 'chain' operations within the Datadog LLM observability integration. It extends a base handler to format and tag spans with input, output, and error information specific to LangChain chains, treating them as workflows.

This file defines a handler for LangChain embedding operations within the LLM Observability tracing system. It processes inputs and results from embedding calls to extract and tag relevant metadata like embedding count and dimensions on the trace spans.

This file defines a handler for LangChain chat models within the LLM Observability system, responsible for extracting and tagging chat-specific metadata like input/output messages, tool calls, and token usage onto tracing spans.
Defines a LangChain LLMObs handler specifically for vector store operations. It extracts and formats vector store query inputs and retrieved document results to tag trace spans for observability.
This file defines a handler for LangChain tools within Datadog's LLM observability integration. It extends the base LangChain handler to extract tool names and tag input/output for tracing purposes.

This file defines a Datadog LLM Observability handler specifically for LangChain LLM (Large Language Model) calls. It is responsible for extracting and tagging LLM inputs, outputs, and token usage metrics onto Datadog spans.

This file defines a handler for LangChain, responsible for processing and formatting LLM-related data for observability. It extracts information such as message content, roles, and token usage from LangChain's internal structures.

This file contains integration tests for the Datadog `dd-trace` LLM Observability plugin for the `@ai-sdk/openai` (Vercel AI SDK) library. It verifies that various AI SDK operations like text generation, object generation, embedding, and streaming are correctly instrumented and produce the expected LLM observability spans.

This file contains integration tests for Datadog's LLM Observability feature, ensuring it correctly instruments and captures data from various LangChain LLM and chat model interactions (e.g., OpenAI, Cohere, Anthropic). It verifies that LLM spans are generated with accurate metadata, metrics, and error handling across different LangChain versions.
This file defines the main Datadog AI plugin for Vercel, which combines LLM observability and tracing functionalities into a single composite plugin.
This file implements a Datadog tracing plugin (`VercelAITracingPlugin`) to instrument and trace AI model operations, capturing AI-specific metadata like model ID and provider.
This file provides a utility function to extract and normalize token usage (input, output, and total) from an LLM output object, handling different naming conventions for token counts.

This file defines and exports a composite Datadog plugin for LangChain, combining both LLM observability and tracing functionalities. It orchestrates the loading and ordering of these specialized LangChain plugins into a single `LangChainPlugin`.

This file defines and configures various Datadog tracing plugins specifically for different operations within the LangChain framework. It enables automatic tracing of LangChain components like chains, language models, embeddings, and tools, capturing relevant metadata in Datadog spans.
This file defines a default, no-operation handler for LangChain components within the Datadog tracing plugin. It provides placeholder methods that do nothing by default.
This file defines a handler for LangChain language models, extending the default handler. It provides methods to extract the provider and model name from LangChain LLM instances.
This file defines a `LangChainEmbeddingHandler` class that processes LangChain embedding operations. It provides methods to extract the provider and model name from embedding instances.

This file contains integration tests for the Datadog Langchain plugin, verifying that it correctly instruments and traces calls to various LLM providers (like OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google GenAI) made through the Langchain library.

This directory is designated to hold static test data, mock objects, or sample files (fixtures) specifically for the `datadog-plugin-langchain` package's tests. Its purpose is to provide controlled and consistent inputs for unit and integration testing of the Langchain plugin within the Datadog tracing library for JavaScript.
This file instruments methods from the `@google-cloud/vertexai` library to provide distributed tracing for generative AI model interactions and chat sessions.

This file implements a plugin for Datadog LLM Observability specifically designed for Google Cloud Vertex AI. It extracts relevant data from Vertex AI requests and responses to create LLM observation spans, including input/output messages, model metadata, and token metrics.

This file implements an LLM Observability plugin for AWS Bedrock Runtime, capturing and tagging LLM-related metadata, I/O, and token usage for `invokeModel` and `invokeModelWithResponseStream` operations.

This file contains integration tests for the Datadog LLM Observability feature with the `@google-cloud/vertexai` library. It mocks Vertex AI API responses and asserts that correct LLM Observability spans are generated for different model interactions.

This file contains integration tests for the LLM Observability (LLMObs) feature with the AWS SDK Bedrock Runtime client. It verifies that LLMObs spans are correctly generated and populated when invoking Bedrock models, including streaming responses and handling cache tokens.

This directory is intended to store recorded network interactions, often called 'cassettes', specifically for testing the integration of `dd-trace-js` with Azure OpenAI services. These cassettes enable repeatable and isolated tests without hitting the actual Azure OpenAI APIs.

This directory is intended to store recorded network interactions, or 'cassettes,' specifically for testing Datadog's JavaScript tracer integration with the AWS Bedrock Runtime service. These cassettes enable reliable and reproducible tests for LLM observability features by mocking external API calls.

This file contains integration tests for the Datadog AWS SDK plugin, specifically verifying its instrumentation of Amazon Bedrock Runtime client operations (InvokeModel and InvokeModelWithResponseStream). It ensures that the plugin correctly captures tracing metadata for various Bedrock models and AWS SDK versions.

This file contains fixture data for testing various AWS Bedrock AI models, including their request configurations and expected responses. It defines model-specific parameters, prompts, and simulated outputs for different AI providers.

This file defines the `BedrockRuntimePlugin`, a composite plugin for Datadog that integrates both LLM Observability (LLMObs) and distributed tracing for AWS Bedrock Runtime services. It acts as the entry point for Bedrock Runtime instrumentation within the AWS SDK plugin.

This file implements tracing for the AWS Bedrock Runtime service within the Datadog AWS SDK plugin. It enables tracing for specific model invocation operations and enriches the generated traces with Bedrock-specific tags like model ID and provider.

This file provides utility functions and classes for processing AWS Bedrock requests and responses, including parsing model identifiers, extracting request parameters, and handling streamed output from various AI model providers.
This file defines a composite plugin for Google Cloud Vertex AI, integrating both LLM Observability and distributed tracing functionalities.

This file provides utility functions for extracting model names and system instructions from objects, likely related to Google Cloud Vertex AI instances. It normalizes data extraction from various potential source properties.

This file contains integration tests for the Datadog tracing plugin for Google Cloud Vertex AI. It verifies that various Vertex AI API calls, such as `generateContent` and `chatSession.sendMessage`, are correctly instrumented and traced.

This file contains integration tests for the Datadog plugin for Google Cloud Vertex AI, ensuring that Vertex AI requests are correctly instrumented and generate expected Datadog spans across different module loading variants.

This file instruments the `@anthropic-ai/sdk` to provide tracing for its message creation API calls, including handling and capturing data from streamed responses. It uses shimming to wrap the `create` method and publish tracing events.

This file instruments the OpenAI Node.js SDK, wrapping its API methods to automatically trace requests and responses for APM. It supports different SDK versions and handles both standard and streamed API interactions, publishing tracing events through `dc-polyfill` channels.

This file defines the Anthropic LLM Observability plugin for Datadog's tracing library. It processes Anthropic API request and response data, including streaming chunks, to extract and tag relevant information such as input/output messages, metadata, and token usage onto LLM spans.
This file defines constants for different input types (image, file, text) and their corresponding fallback string values. It centralizes these fixed string literals for use within the OpenAI plugin.

This file implements the LLM Observability plugin for OpenAI, responsible for tracing and tagging various OpenAI API operations (like completions, chat completions, and embeddings) with relevant metadata, metrics, and input/output for monitoring.

This file contains integration tests for the OpenAI plugin (versions <4) within the Datadog tracer, specifically verifying the generation and content of LLM observability spans for various OpenAI API calls like completions, chat completions, and embeddings, including error scenarios.

This file contains integration tests for Datadog's LLM Observability feature, specifically verifying the tracing and event generation for various OpenAI API v4 functionalities, including completions, chat completions (with and without tools), embeddings, and streamed responses.

This file contains integration tests for Datadog's LLM Observability feature with the Anthropic client library. It verifies that various Anthropic API calls, including streaming messages and beta functionalities, correctly generate APM and LLM Observability spans with the expected data.

This directory stores VCR (cassette) recordings for integration tests related to Datadog's Large Language Model Observability features, specifically for interactions with the Anthropic API within the `dd-trace-js` package.

This directory is designated to store recorded HTTP interactions, often called "cassettes," for tests related to OpenAI's Large Language Models within the `dd-trace-js` package. These cassettes enable consistent and isolated testing of the Datadog tracing integration for LLMs by providing mocked API responses.
This file contains integration tests for the Datadog AI plugin, specifically verifying its instrumentation of AI SDKs in an ESM environment by asserting traces received by a fake agent.

This file defines the main Datadog plugin for Anthropic, combining LLM observability and distributed tracing functionalities. It acts as a composite plugin that integrates specific tracing and LLM observation modules for Anthropic API interactions.
This file implements a tracing plugin for Anthropic API requests. It creates and manages spans to capture the lifecycle and metadata of Anthropic operations for observability purposes.

This file contains integration tests for the Datadog Anthropic plugin, verifying that tracing spans are correctly generated for Anthropic API calls, including both standard and streaming message creation methods.
This file defines the main OpenAI plugin for Datadog, combining both LLM observability and tracing functionalities for OpenAI API interactions.

This file provides utility functions for processing and combining streamed data chunks from various OpenAI APIs (completions, chat completions, and responses API) into complete response objects. It handles parsing raw buffers and aggregating incremental updates.

This file provides initialization and shutdown functions for DogStatsD metrics and an external logger specifically for the Datadog OpenAI plugin. It configures these services based on the provided tracer configuration.

This file implements a Datadog tracing plugin for OpenAI API requests. It instruments various OpenAI operations, captures span data, metrics, and logs, and handles the processing of streaming responses.

This file contains unit tests for the `services` module of the Datadog OpenAI plugin, specifically verifying its initialization, shutdown, and error handling for metrics and logging when configurations are missing or null.
This test file verifies a bug fix related to the initialization order of `dd-trace` and the OpenAI library, ensuring that the OpenAI plugin does not error if `dd-trace` is not initialized first.
This file contains integration tests for the Datadog OpenAI plugin, verifying that it correctly instruments OpenAI API calls, handles errors, maintains context, and records metrics and logs.

This file contains integration tests for the Datadog OpenAI plugin, specifically verifying that the OpenAI client is correctly instrumented when used as an ES module. It tests different versions of the OpenAI library to ensure that 'openai.request' spans are generated and captured by the Datadog agent.

This file implements the DataDog AI Guard SDK client, which evaluates AI prompts and messages by sending them to an external AI Guard service. It integrates with tracing to record evaluation results, apply message truncation, and can block operations based on the service's response.

This file initializes and exports a storage mechanism specifically for LLM Observability (llmobs) data. It leverages a core storage utility to create a dedicated storage instance for LLM-related tracing and monitoring.

Provides a 'no-operation' (noop) implementation for the LLM Observability client, effectively disabling LLM tracing and features when active. It serves as a fallback or placeholder when LLM observation is not enabled.
This file implements the LLMObs (LLM Observability) SDK, providing an interface to enable/disable LLM tracing, instrument LLM calls, and annotate LLM-related spans within Datadog's tracing system.
This file is the main entry point for Datadog's LLM Observability feature, managing its lifecycle, setting up span processing, evaluation metric writing, and distributed tracing integration.

This file contains unit tests for the no-operation (noop) implementation of the LLM Observability SDK. It verifies that the noop SDK exposes the same public methods as the real SDK and that calling these methods does not throw errors.

This file contains unit tests for the DataDog LLM Observability module, verifying its configuration logic for agentless versus agent-proxy modes, LLM-specific trace injection, and evaluation metric handling. It ensures the module correctly initializes and tears down its components based on various runtime conditions and settings.

This file contains integration tests for the LLM Observability SDK, verifying its end-to-end functionality including tracing, wrapping, evaluation submission, distributed context propagation, and custom span processors.

This file contains unit tests for the LLM Observability SDK module, verifying its functionality related to enabling/disabling, tracing LLM-specific spans, and managing span parentage within the Datadog tracing library.

This file contains integration tests for the LLM Observability SDK's TypeScript instrumentation. It compiles and runs TypeScript applications in a sandbox environment, asserting that correct LLM observability spans are generated and reported to a fake agent across various TypeScript versions and test cases.

This file tests the `llmobs` (LLM Observability) feature of the Datadog APM tracing SDK for JavaScript/TypeScript. It demonstrates initialization, method decoration, and data annotation for LLM-related operations.

This file is a test case for Datadog's LLM Observability (llmobs) feature within the `dd-trace-js` SDK, demonstrating and asserting the use of `@llmobs.decorate` and `llmobs.annotate` in a TypeScript class.
This file provides utility functions for LLM Observability, including Unicode encoding, span kind validation, parsing function arguments, and checking span errors.

This file defines the `LLMObsTagger` class, which is responsible for managing and applying annotations (tags) to LLM-related spans within the Datadog tracing system. It handles the registration of LLM spans and the tagging of various LLM data points like input/output, metadata, metrics, and prompt details.

This file defines constants for tags, metrics, and other identifiers used for LLM (Large Language Model) observability within the Datadog tracing system. It standardizes the keys for collecting and reporting LLM-related data.

This file defines the base class for LLM Observability (LLMObs) plugins. It provides common functionality and an abstract interface for managing LLM-related spans and context within the tracing system, which concrete LLMObs plugins will extend.

This file provides utility functions for processing OpenAI chat prompt data, including extracting and reconstructing chat templates with placeholders, normalizing prompt variables, and handling multimodal inputs for LLM observability.

This file provides utility functions for extracting and processing information from OpenTracing spans, particularly for Large Language Model (LLM) observability. It includes functions for parsing LLM usage, model metadata, generation settings, and tool call details from span tags.
This file provides utility functions for LLM (Large Language Model) tracing, including text normalization and sampling logic for prompt completions, configured based on integration settings.

This file contains unit tests for the `tagger` module, specifically verifying its functionality in tagging spans with LLM Observability (LLMObs) related metadata, metrics, and input/output information within the Datadog tracing library.
This file contains unit tests for utility functions used in LLM Observability, including unicode encoding, kind validation, function argument extraction, and checking for errors in spans.

This file provides utility functions and type definitions for testing and asserting the structure and content of LLMObs (Language Model Observability) span events and evaluation metrics within the Datadog APM tracer for JavaScript.

This directory is intended to store test cassettes, which are recorded network interactions, for DeepSeek Large Language Model Observability features within the `dd-trace` package's tests. These cassettes facilitate repeatable and isolated testing by providing mocked API responses.
This file contains unit tests for the LLM utility functions, verifying their behavior for text normalization and prompt completion sampling based on default and custom configurations.

This file provides utility functions for extracting and normalizing the LLM model provider from span tags, including specific handling for AWS Bedrock models. It ensures the model provider adheres to LLM Observability standards.

This file contains integration tests for the Datadog 'ai' plugin, verifying that it correctly instruments AI SDK operations like 'generateText', 'generateObject', and 'embed' by asserting the creation and content of traces and spans. It also tests various configurations for `experimental_telemetry`.

This file provides a utility function for roughly estimating the number of tokens in text content, particularly when a precise tokenization model or library is unavailable. It calculates an approximation based on character count and word count heuristics for English text.
Tests the OpenAI token estimation logic used within the Datadog OpenAI plugin. It verifies the `estimateTokens` function handles various input types correctly.

This file defines functions for recording and reporting various telemetry metrics and events specifically for LLM Observability (LLMObs). It tracks aspects like span lifecycle, payload sizes, errors, and feature usage within the LLMObs system.

This file defines the `LLMObsSpanProcessor`, which is responsible for extracting, formatting, and processing LLM-related data from trace spans into a specialized LLM Observability event format, and then sending these events to an LLM Observability writer.
This file defines a writer specifically designed to send LLM Observability (LLMObs) evaluation metrics to a designated endpoint. It structures evaluation metric events for transmission.

This file implements the LLMObsSpanWriter, responsible for appending, truncating, and formatting LLM observability span events before they are sent to the intake API, handling size limits and dropping excessive input/output data.

This file provides utility functions for LLM Observability (LLMobs) writers, including determining the agent communication strategy (agent-based vs. agentless) and parsing/logging responses from LLMobs event submissions.

This file defines a base class for buffering and sending LLM Observability (LLMObs) events. It manages event storage for both single and multi-tenant scenarios, periodically flushes these events, and handles the HTTP requests to send them to the appropriate Datadog intake or agent endpoint.
Defines constant strings used within the LLM Observability module, specifically for indicating dropped or unserializable values in spans.

This file defines constants for LLM Observability (LLMObs) data ingestion, including endpoint paths, event types, intake names, and related proxy settings and size limits for spans and evaluation metrics within the Datadog tracing library.
This file contains unit tests for the LLMObsSpanProcessor, verifying its functionality in processing and formatting LLM-related span data for submission to the LLM Observability backend.

This file contains unit tests for the LLMObsEvalMetricsWriter, verifying its ability to construct correct URLs for agentless and agent-proxied requests, and to properly format payloads for LLM evaluation metrics.

This file contains unit tests for the `LLMObsSpanWriter` class, which is responsible for handling and sending LLM Observability span events. It verifies its initialization, agentless/agent proxy behavior, event buffering, size limits, and payload creation.

This file contains unit tests for the `BaseLLMObsWriter` class, verifying its functionality for writing LLM observability data, including configuration, event buffering, and flushing mechanisms. It covers agentless and agent proxy modes, URL construction, and lifecycle management.

This file contains unit tests for the multi-tenant routing functionality within the LLM Observability (LLMObs) writers. It verifies that LLM events and evaluations are correctly routed to different endpoints based on API keys and sites, ensuring tenant isolation and proper handling of routing contexts.

Crash Tracking & Diagnostics.description: Captures and reports unhandled exceptions and application crashes with detailed stack traces and system context. It also includes tools for collecting diagnostic information to help developers debug and resolve stability issues.

files.description: This file instruments `process.setUncaughtExceptionCaptureCallback` to allow interception and custom logic before the uncaught exception handler is set. It uses `shimmer` to wrap the method and `dc-polyfill` channels for event emission.

This file implements a singleton `Crashtracker` class that initializes and configures the native Datadog crash tracking library for Node.js applications, collecting relevant metadata and process information.
This module conditionally exports a crash tracker implementation for the main thread, falling back to a no-operation module if loading fails or if executed in a worker thread.

Provides a no-operation (noop) implementation of a crash tracker, serving as a placeholder when crash tracking functionality is not enabled or needed. It defines an interface with empty methods for configuring, starting, and profiling.
This file provides utilities for parsing and filtering JavaScript stack traces, extracting user-land code frames while excluding those from `node_modules` or internal Datadog instrumentation.

This file contains unit tests for the `crashtracking` module, verifying its behavior when a functional crash tracker is available, when it falls back to a no-op implementation due to errors, and when operating within a worker thread.
This file contains unit tests for the `crashtracker` module, verifying its initialization, configuration, and how it handles various tags and error conditions via the `libdatadog` binding.

This test file verifies that the `crashtracking` module defaults to the `noop` (no operation) implementation for starting and configuring crash tracking, likely for scenarios like worker environments where full crash tracking might not be available.

This file contains unit tests for the stack trace utility functions, specifically `getCallSites` and `parseUserLandFrames`. It verifies the correct parsing of various stack frame formats, including different function names, file paths, and method/class types.
This Next.js test page intentionally throws an error within `getServerSideProps` to test error handling mechanisms. It is part of the Datadog Next.js plugin test suite.
This file defines a Next.js API route designed to intentionally throw an error for testing error handling within the 'datadog-plugin-next' package. It serves as a test case for error instrumentation.
This file defines a `FlareFile` class, which is a custom writable stream that buffers all data written to it in memory, dynamically resizing its internal buffer as needed.

This file implements the Datadog Tracer's 'flare' functionality, which collects diagnostic information including tracer configuration and logs, and sends them to a Datadog endpoint for debugging and support purposes.

This file defines logging channels for different log levels (e.g., trace, debug, info) and provides a `LogChannel` class to manage subscriptions to these channels based on a configurable minimum log level.

This file contains unit tests for the 'flare' module, which is responsible for collecting and sending diagnostic information (tracer details, logs) to a configured endpoint. It uses a mock HTTP server to verify the data sent during a flare submission.

This file contains tests for the `startup-log` module, verifying that it correctly formats and outputs tracer configuration and diagnostic messages to the console based on various settings and environment variables. It specifically checks the logging of features like data streams and profiling.

Data Streams Monitoring (DSM).description: Monitors the health and performance of data pipelines by tracking data flow across messaging systems like Kafka and RabbitMQ. It provides end-to-end visibility into message queues, latency, and throughput between services.

files.description: This file implements the FNV (Fowler-Noll-Vo) hash function, specifically providing a 64-bit FNV-1a hash for data streams.

This file defines a `DataStreamsCheckpointer` class responsible for managing checkpoints in data stream tracing. It provides methods to set 'produce' and 'consume' checkpoints, handling context injection and extraction for distributed tracing across data streaming operations.

Manages Data Streams functionality by setting checkpoints for tracing data flows and decoding incoming Data Streams contexts. It coordinates interactions between a data streams processor and the global DataStreamsContext.
Provides utility functions to calculate the byte size of various data structures, including strings, buffers, arrays, and message components like headers, keys, and values, for data streams.

This file provides functions for encoding and decoding signed 64-bit integers using zig-zag and variable-length encoding, optimized for JavaScript's number limitations by handling numbers in high and low 32-bit parts.

This file serves as the central entry point for Data Streams Monitoring (DSM) functionalities. It utilizes a `lazyClass` pattern to defer the loading of various DSM-related components like codecs, checkpointers, and managers, along with providing utility functions for message size calculation.

This file defines the DataStreamsWriter class, which is responsible for encoding, compressing, and sending DataStreams payloads to a Datadog agent's pipeline stats endpoint. It handles the serialization, compression, and network request for data stream telemetry.
Provides functions to get and set the DataStreams context from the application's storage. It acts as an interface for managing distributed tracing context related to data streams.

This file provides utilities for computing, encoding, and decoding pathway hashes and context for Data Streams monitoring, including functions for cryptographic hashing, context serialization, and propagation across services.

This file defines the core Data Streams Processor responsible for collecting, aggregating, and reporting Data Streams Monitoring (DSM) metrics like latencies, payload sizes, and backlog offsets. It manages time-based buckets of statistics and flushes them periodically to a writer.

This file implements a propagator for Data Streams Monitoring (DSM) context, allowing it to be injected into and extracted from a carrier (e.g., HTTP headers) using a text map format. It leverages a DSM pathway codec to encode and decode the context for distributed tracing of data streams.
Tests the DataStreamsWriter class, specifically verifying its behavior when flushing data to a Unix socket endpoint.

This file contains unit tests for the Data Streams Monitoring (DSM) checkpointer API, verifying that manual and automatic checkpoints are correctly set for both producing and consuming data streams, and that associated DSM stats and tags are properly generated.

This file contains unit tests for the DataStreamsProcessor and its associated statistical aggregation components like StatsPoint, StatsBucket, and TimeBuckets, ensuring they correctly track and process data stream checkpoints and backlogs.
This file contains unit tests for the Data Streams Monitoring (DSM) pathway context encoding and decoding functions, including hash computation, base64 encoding, and the `DsmPathwayCodec`.

This file contains unit tests for the variable integer encoding and decoding functions (`encodeVarint` and `decodeVarint`) used in the datastreams feature of dd-trace-js, ensuring they correctly handle various integer sizes and edge cases.
This file defines the `Schema` class, a fundamental data structure for representing schemas within the datastreams feature of the `dd-trace-js` library.

This file defines a `SchemaSampler` class responsible for time-based sampling logic, accumulating a 'weight' and allowing a sample to be taken at regular intervals. It helps control the frequency of schema-related operations or data collection.

This file defines a `SchemaPlugin` that extends the base `Plugin` class to attach schema-related information to active spans during serialization and deserialization events. It is used to enrich traces with schema details, likely for Distributed Service Mesh (DSM) functionality.
This file contains unit tests for the `SchemaSampler` class, verifying its ability to determine if a schema can be sampled and to calculate the correct sampling weights based on time intervals.
This file defines the AvscPlugin for DataDog tracing, which extends the base SchemaPlugin to provide schema extraction capabilities specifically for Avro schemas (AVSC).

This file defines the `SchemaExtractor` class, which is responsible for parsing Avro schema definitions, extracting their properties, and attaching schema-related metadata to tracing spans for Data Streams Monitoring (DSM).
Defines the Datadog plugin for protobufjs, which extends the base SchemaPlugin to extract schema information from protobuf.js definitions.

This file defines a `SchemaExtractor` class responsible for parsing Protocol Buffers (Protobuf) schema definitions. It extracts schema details and attaches them as tags to Datadog spans, facilitating schema-aware data stream monitoring.
This file defines and runs a test suite for the `amqp10` plugin, specifically targeting the `noodlefrenzy/node-amqp10` library.

Tests Data Streams Monitoring (DSM) functionality for the `amqplib` plugin, verifying that pathway hashes and DSM stats are correctly generated and emitted for message production and consumption via RabbitMQ queues and exchanges.
Provides helper functions for testing interactions with AWS Kinesis streams, including putting and getting records, and managing stream states.

This file contains integration tests for the Data Streams Monitoring (DSM) functionality of the Datadog AWS SDK plugin, specifically for SQS operations. It verifies that pathway hashes are correctly applied to spans and DSM stats are emitted to the agent for SQS message production and consumption.

This file contains integration tests for the Datadog AWS SDK plugin, specifically verifying tracing and payload redaction functionalities for AWS SNS (Simple Notification Service) operations. It tests various scenarios including payload tagging, user-defined redaction, and internal redaction of sensitive information like phone numbers across different AWS SDK versions.
This file contains integration tests for the Data Streams Monitoring (DSM) functionality of the Datadog AWS SDK plugin, specifically verifying tracing and metrics for AWS SNS and SQS interactions.
This file contains integration tests for the Datadog tracing plugin for AWS Kinesis, verifying trace context injection into Kinesis records and proper span generation for Kinesis operations.

This test utility file defines the expected naming schemas (service and operation names) for AWS SQS traces, categorized by producer, consumer, and client roles, to be used in integration tests for the AWS SDK plugin.

This file contains integration tests for the Data Streams Monitoring (DSM) feature of the Datadog AWS SDK plugin, specifically for Amazon Kinesis. It verifies that DSM pathway hashes are correctly propagated and emitted as stats for Kinesis `putRecord`, `putRecords`, and `getRecord` operations.

This file implements a Datadog tracing plugin for AWS SQS, handling both producer and consumer operations. It injects and extracts trace context and Data Streams Monitoring (DSM) information into SQS messages for distributed tracing and monitoring.
This file implements a Datadog plugin for AWS Kinesis, providing tracing and Data Streams Monitoring (DSM) capabilities by injecting and extracting context from Kinesis records.

This file is an integration test client for the Datadog Azure Event Hubs plugin, verifying that the `tryAdd` method returns a boolean (not a Promise) and correctly traces Azure Event Hubs operations in an ESM environment.
This file defines a Datadog tracing plugin for BullMQ consumers, enabling distributed tracing and data streams monitoring for job processing.

This file contains integration tests for the BullMQ plugin, verifying span generation for BullMQ operations like queueing, processing, and flow production. It also ensures correct distributed tracing context propagation between producer and consumer spans, including error handling scenarios.

This test file verifies the Data Streams Monitoring (DSM) functionality for the BullMQ integration in the Datadog tracer. It ensures that checkpoints are correctly set and payload sizes are recorded for message production and consumption events within BullMQ queues.
This file serves as the main entry point for the Datadog tracing plugin for `confluentinc-kafka-javascript`, combining and exporting its producer, consumer, and batch consumer instrumentation.

This file defines the expected naming conventions (operation and service names) for Kafka 'send' and 'receive' operations, used for testing the Confluent Kafka JavaScript plugin's tracing behavior across different schema versions.

This file contains integration tests for the `confluentinc-kafka-javascript` plugin for Datadog's `dd-trace`. It verifies the instrumentation of Kafka producers and consumers using both the KafkaJS API wrapper and the native `rdKafka` API, including span creation, context propagation, and error handling.

This file contains integration tests for the Data Streams Monitoring (DSM) functionality of the Datadog plugin for '@confluentinc/kafka-javascript', ensuring proper checkpointing and backlog tracking for Kafka producers and consumers.

This file contains integration tests for the Datadog Azure Functions plugin, specifically verifying its ability to trace and propagate context across Azure Event Hubs operations for both single and batch event processing.

This file contains integration tests for the Datadog Google Cloud Pub/Sub plugin, specifically verifying the Data Stream Monitoring (DSM) functionality by checking checkpoint recording and payload size tracking during message publication and consumption.

This file implements a Datadog tracing plugin for Google Cloud Pub/Sub producers, injecting trace context into messages and creating spans for individual and batched publish operations, including support for Data Streams Monitoring.
This file serves as the main entry point for the Datadog tracing plugin for KafkaJS, orchestrating the integration of producer, consumer, and batch consumer tracing functionalities.

This file implements a Data Streams Monitoring (DSM) plugin for KafkaJS consumers, specifically designed to process batches of messages. It extracts tracing context and sets DSM checkpoints for each message within a consumed batch.

This file implements a plugin for instrumenting KafkaJS producers. It handles the injection of trace context and Data Streams Monitoring (DSM) pathway information into Kafka message headers during message production, and processes producer responses for DSM.

This file contains unit and integration tests for the `kafkajs` plugin of `dd-trace-js`, specifically verifying instrumentation of Kafka producers and consumers, error handling, and context propagation.
This test utility file defines the expected naming conventions and schemas for tracing KafkaJS operations (send and receive) for different API versions within the Datadog tracing plugin.

This file contains integration tests for the Data Stream Monitoring (DSM) functionality of the Datadog KafkaJS plugin. It verifies that checkpoints and backlogs are correctly set for Kafka producer and consumer operations.
This file is the main entry point for the Datadog tracing plugin for the 'rhea' library, acting as a composite plugin that orchestrates both producer and consumer tracing functionalities.
Defines a Datadog tracing plugin for consuming AMQP 1.0 messages using the 'rhea' library, including span creation and Data Streams Monitoring (DSM) integration.
